EAScenario.name: Nutrition App
EAScenario.description:
Value proposition: Nutrition is a problem for many elderly, either because of cognitive failure which results in forgetting to eat well, or because of social challenges that make it difficult for elderly to give enough attention to their nutrition needs. This application demonstrates how universAAL technology can help the elderly in keeping a healthy diet and keeping healthy. Basic functionality:
  • Keep an overview of what the user eats through e.g. electronic tagging of food that is purchased and consumed.
  • Monitor compliance with healthy diets based on user’s biological conditions, e.g. monitor whether the user eats what he/she should eat.
  • Communication with kitchen appliances in order to monitor and assist elderly with preparing and eating healthy.
  • Communicate with foreign domains such as supermarkets and shops in order to assist during shopping, both physical (visiting the shop) and online.
  • Interaction through embedded devices (e.g. screen on the refrigerator) and mobile devices (e.g. smart phones).
Pros:
  • Important topic seen from a health and well-being perspective.
  • Can demonstrate integration of physical and digital world. Food is a very physical thing.
  • Can demonstrate how universAAL creates value for businesses that might be completely unrelated to AAL, e.g. supermarkets. Expands universAAL value network.
Cons:
  • Can become a too futuristic scenario if focus becomes on tracking of physical things. E.g. no kitchen appliances or food are currently tagged. There is currently no business model for this type of tracking. Impact might become very low or non-existing.
  • Can become a scenario demonstrating the potential of uAAL seen from an ambient intelligence perspective only.
